main_definition: The back part of the foot below the ankle, often used in various expressions to indicate actions or positions related to this body part.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To follow closely behind someone or something.
meanings_and_examples.example: After running at a full sprint, he quickly tried to keep up with his friend.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The lowest part of an object or structure, often used in reference to buildings and furniture.
meanings_and_examples.example: She sat down on the edge of the coffee table to read her book comfortably.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To avoid responsibility for something by shifting blame onto someone else.
meanings_and_examples.example: He tried to make excuses and say that he wasn't responsible for the mistake, but it was clear he was just putting his foot in his mouth.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A small unit of measurement equaling 12 inches (30.48 centimeters).
meanings_and_examples.example: The carpenter measured out a piece that was one hundred and twenty-eight inches long, or eight feet.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To bend slightly at the waist while standing.
meanings_and_examples.example: She gracefully heeled to pick up her dropped scarf without interrupting her stride.
